Table 11. Cause of death of local jail inmates, by time served before death, 2000–19
Report title: Mortality in Local Jails, 2000–2019 – Statistical Tables   NCJ 301368
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Mortality in Correctional Institutions, 2000–19
Author: E. Ann Carson, Ph.D., BJS Statistician
Refer questions to: askbjs@usdoj.gov 202-307-0765
Date of version: 12/1/2021
Table 11. Cause of death of local jail inmates, by time served before death, 2000–19
Cause of death
Illness
Suicide
Drug/alcohol intoxication
Accident
Homicide/d
Note: Details may not sum to totals due to missing data. See Methodology.
a/The statistical median represents the value at which 50% of the values are larger and 50% are smaller in a sequence of numbers.
b/Includes persons who died of illness and were identified as HIV-positive or having AIDS at the time of death.
c/Includes other specified illnesses (such as cerebrovascular disease, influenza, and other nonleading natural causes of death) and unspecified illnesses.
d/Includes homicides committed by other inmates, incidental to the use of force by staff, and resulting from assaults sustained prior to incarceration.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Mortality in Correctional Institutions, 2000–19.
